result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Waived reading of the complaint Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:29 PM Defendant Raul Portillo Castaneda in court, in custody from Mendota.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Raul Portillo Castaneda.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter  Defendant found competent at this time to proceed with all the matters.  State is in agreement with the competency report.  Court finds that the defendant is no longer incompetent. proceedings are reinstated.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 11:09 AM Defendant Raul Portillo Castaneda appeared by video from Mendota.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Raul Portillo Castaneda.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter appeared in person.  All parties have received competency report.  No objections by the defense with Dr.'s findings, not contesting the findings.  State is also in agreement with the report.   Court finds that the defendant is incompetent, but is likely to regain competency in the statutory time period of 12 months on the felony cases.  The forfeitures will track along with the felonies.  Proceedings remain suspended.  Periodic exams 3 month, 6 months, 9 months.  Parties to request a hearing when reports show that he has regained competency.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:49 AM Defendant Raul Portillo Castaneda in court in custody from Clark County Jail.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Raul Portillo Castaneda.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter   State raises the issue of competency.  Court finds probable cause and suspends the proceedings  Competency evaluation ordered.  .
Competency hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is not indigent and not eligible for PD representation

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.

1:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raul Portillo Castaneda in court. Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter appeared by video.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
